Caroline County Public Schools is pleased to present a 2020-2021 draft Instructional Calendar for stakeholder review and comment. The CCPS 2020-2021 draft Instructional Calendar reflects committee input and feedback from multiple superintendent advisory groups as well as contractual and state mandates that provide parameters for calendar development. Together, we will design an academic calendar that supports high-quality teaching and learning.

Please take a moment to review the 2020-2021 draft Instructional Calendar and provide feedback. Thank you for your feedback and time!

https://www.ccps.us/wp-content/uploads/2019/12/CCPS-2020-2021-Instructional-Calendar-DRAFT.pdf

https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSeLx2NJMIwsbEvhYE1QGtrTO1pS-Dqv0JGiy5RuZqXg7MfzDw/viewform

post_text:
Full Life Ahead - On November 7, 2019, Caroline County Public School’s Parent Teacher Resource Center hosted a “Full Life Ahead” Transition workshop. Susan Gayle, PTRC Special Education Coordinator, and Melissa White, Special Education Transition Coordinator, welcomed thirty educators, parents, grandparents, and students with a two-hour workshop. This workshop provided the attendees with a framework for success as they transition from middle school to high school or from high school to adult life.
The CCPS Special Education Department and Virginia Department of Education supplied participants with a workbook and guide to assist with transition goals and expectations. This workshop is funded through a grant Caroline County’s Parent Teacher Resource Center secured in 2018. The resources purchased have enabled the PTRC to offer this workshop 1-2 times each school year.
The “Full Life Ahead” workshop aligns with the CCPS Strategic Plan Pathways 2020 as we prepare students to be successfully employed, enlisted or enrolled.

post_text:
TRICK OF THE TRADE: Building relationships with students AND parents.

VALERIE SILVA, a bus driver for CCPS, has been working in the school division for over 27 years. She is one of the most dedicated drivers who loves her children as if they were her own. Mrs.Silva takes the time to listen to each and every child that walks onto her bus, no matter how trivial or small their concern may be. She builds one-on-one relationships with their parents and it is because of this that she is called "Sunshine", for she brightens up everyone's day. Mrs. Silva attributes her success to her colleagues and supervisor in the transportation department for all the training and mentoring that they have poured into her.

post_text: Lynn Lenahan, resident of Bowling Green and a full time Realtor with 1st Choice Better Homes and Land, LC, presented Bowling Green Elementary School with an $880.00 check today. Each time a 1st Choice BHL agent closes a transaction, a donation is made to an account set up by 1st Choice BHL and a drawing is held every 2 months. Lynn Lenahan was thrilled that her name was drawn. She chose BGE as the recipient, and 1st Choice BHL matched the donation. Thank you so much to Lynn Lenahan and 1st Choice BHL for supporting Caroline County Public Schools!

post_text:
Fourth Grade students of Lewis & Clark Elementary presented a program titled Harmony.
Students sang songs: United We Stand, Do the Good You Know, and In This World Together . They highlighted their daily program, Sanford Harmony, by showing how they begin each day in class. The Sanford Harmony program reinforces the value of spreading kindness, caring for others, showing compassion, and goodwill to all.
The fourth grade students musically expressed how they and all LCES students aim to work together in harmony.

post_text:
Student of the Month- November
Caroline High School

Madison Nutter, daughter of Travis and Shelley Nutter, was selected as Student of the Month for November at Caroline High School. She is president of the senior class, treasurer of the National Honor Society, a member of Mu Alpha Theta, Beta, and a representative of the Student Council Association and Chick-fil-A Leader Academy. Madison is also a captain of the varsity cheerleading squad and has made the competition team all four years. She earned 1st Team All District and 1st Team All Region after this year’s season. She is an active member of the Wright’s Chapel youth group where she has been on mission trips and she has also assisted with the blood drives here at CHS.

After graduation Maddie plans to attend a four year university and major in elementary education.

post_text:
This afternoon, at the awards luncheon during the Virginia School Boards Association (VSBA) Annual Convention, the Caroline County School Board was designated as a VSBA Board of Distinction. Boards receiving this award must apply for it and meet specific requirements in four key areas: planning, policy, promotion, and board development. A panel of judges reviews the criteria submitted and determines those awarded the VSBA Board of Distinction status. [ 103 more words ]
https://www.ccps.us/2019/11/caroline-county-school-board-designated-as-vsba-board-of-distinction/

post_text:
On November 7th the Career Coach partnered with Junior Achievement of Central Virginia and Luck Stone in Milford Va for a job shadow opportunity. Ten students learned about workplace readiness skills, career opportunities, and the history of Luck Stone Industries. Students also where given a tour and participated in a working lunch on site.

The Career Cafe held on November 14th hosted Stephen C. Letchford, L.S., Survey Manager of AES Consulting Engineers. Mr. Letchford discussed the various career pathways for surveying, what the job is really like , and the great need for surveyors in the future. For more information on this career, please visit Virginia Association of Surveyors for more information.

post_text:
CHS Automotive Earns Conditional National Accreditation Status
On October 24th and 25th a team from the Automotive Service Excellence Education Foundation completed a review of the Automotive Training Program at CHS. Twelve Automotive Program standards were analyzed and assessed. Congratulations to Mr. Anderson and his students for becoming conditionally accredited. We look forward to achieving full accreditation status after our next review 2.5 years from now.

The students had to pick a fairy tale and then write an adaptation of that fairy tale by changing one or more of the elements. The students participated in a publishing party complete with snacks and Disney music. They shared their writing and then provided feedback (a compliment) to three people in the class.

post_text: Thursday, November 14th, Madison Elementary hosted their first Title I Parent Advisory Committee meeting (PAC) along with family game night. During the PAC meeting, ESL, PreK and Title I instructional highlights were shared, healthy snacks were offered and each family left with a conversational starter book to encourage family engagement! The game night portion of the evening offered interactive games for families to reinforce literacy, math and STEM skills. It was a great night at MES!

post_text: THANKS to all CCPS students, educators, and school leaders for an awesome Take Your Legislators to School Day! ALL community partners and legislators were impressed with the teaching and learning in CCPS!!!
text: THANKS to all CCPS students, educators, and school leaders for an awesome Take Your Legislators to School Day! ALL community partners and legislators were impressed with the teaching and learning in CCPS!!!

post_text: CMS FFA would like to congratulate 6th grader, Sarah Rowe, for placing first in her category for the Soil & Water Poster Contest in the Hanover/Caroline district. Her poster will travel to the state level. We wish her the best of luck!
text: CMS FFA would like to congratulate 6th grader, Sarah Rowe, for placing first in her category for the Soil & Water Poster Contest in the Hanover/Caroline district. Her poster will travel to the state level. We wish her the best of luck!

post_text:
CMS and NJHS host a Thanksgiving canned food drive every year. Over 30 CCPS families in need were served last year receiving a basket of canned goods and a turkey or gift card.

This year’s canned goods goal is 2,000 cans! CMS student, Kade Oelberg, collected over 75 cans tonight in Lake Caroline. Great work, Kade! #OneCaroline
